items.summary: A worldwide technology snag at Navitaire, an airline reservation platform, caused temporary disruption for some Indian carriers on Thursday morning. Systems were restored swiftly with no major flight delays.

items.title: Bangladesh bars SpiceJet from using its airspace over dues; airline says working for early resolution
items.summary: Bangladesh has barred SpiceJet from using its airspace over unpaid dues, forcing the airline to take longer routes on some Kolkata flights, including to Guwahati and Imphal. A SpiceJet spokesperson said the airline is in talks with authorities and flight operations remain unaffected. Shares fell nearly 1% to Rs 16.81 on the BSE.

items.title: JioHotstar brings ChatGPT voice assistant to help you decide what to watch
items.summary: JioHotstar is introducing a new voice assistant powered by ChatGPT. Viewers can now discover movies, shows, and live sports by speaking their preferences. This feature allows for natural language queries across multiple languages. It aims to make content discovery more interactive and personalized. The integration will also provide JioHotstar recommendations when using ChatGPT.

items.title: 10+ MFs added 11 stocks in January ’26; 50–100% surge in a year, one turned multibagger
items.summary: Mutual funds sustained strong buying momentum in January 2026, investing over Rs 42,000 crore in equities. ETMarkets analysis shows 31 stocks were added across multiple schemes, with 11 delivering 50–100% returns over one year, including a multibagger, highlighting continued institutional conviction in select banking and financial stocks.

items.title: Global Markets | Australian shares hit record high on earnings optimism; banks, miners lead broad rally
items.summary: Australian shares reached an all-time peak on Thursday. Strong company earnings fueled widespread gains. Banks and miners led the advance. The S&P/ASX 200 index climbed significantly. Investors are watching upcoming earnings reports. Unemployment data also influenced market sentiment. Copper prices boosted mining stocks. Some individual companies experienced sharp movements.

items.title: SpiceJet secures MoU for 10 aircraft; eyes major capacity ramp-up by Winter
items.summary: SpiceJet said its recovery has accelerated in recent months, with the airline doubling its capacity in the last quarter. Available Seat Kilometres (ASKMs) rose from around 55 crore to 105 crore, reflecting a sharp expansion in operational strength and route deployment.

items.title: JioHotstar partners OpenAI to launch ChatGPT-powered conversational streaming in India
items.summary: JioHotstar-OpenAI deal: For more than a decade, digital entertainment has largely been a one-way experience: browse, click, watch. With this rollout, JioHotstar is positioning streaming as a two-way interaction that interprets nuance, layered prompts and cultural context in real time.

items.title: ITC's worst is behind, but patience required: Abneesh Roy names better FMCG bets for 2025
items.summary: Consumer analyst Abneesh Roy sees a real FMCG revival driven by GST cuts, steady rural demand, and recovering urban consumption. He highlights Nestle, Britannia, Marico, and Tata Consumer as near-term beneficiaries, while positioning ITC as a one-to-two-year recovery play after a tax shock. Hindustan Unilever's premium beauty investment is also noted as a structural re-rating catalyst.

items.title: Zydus launches biosimilar for ophthalmic care
items.summary: Zydus Lifesciences has introduced Anyra, its first indigenously developed biosimilar  for the treatment of visual impairment in India. This innovative drug, akin to Aflibercept 2 mg, addresses vision loss resulting from diseases like diabetes.

items.title: OpenAI, TCS and Tata Group partner to build AI infrastructure in India—Why this matters for TCS and India
items.summary: As part of the agreement, TCS’ HyperVault unit will build AI infrastructure in India with an initial capacity of 100 megawatt (MW). This capacity can be expanded to 1 gigawatt (GW) over time. The infrastructure will support large AI computing needs of companies and help both Indian and global firms use AI tools more efficiently.

items.title: We expect 7-8 brands to cross ₹1,000 cr-revenue mark in few years: RCPL Director T Krishnakumar

items.summary: The brokerage expects healthy revenue and profit growth over the medium term, supported by premiumisation, deeper penetration in tier-2 and tier-3 cities, higher localisation and an integrated operating model that supports margins and capital efficiency.

items.summary: The India-EU trade agreement is largely rooted in rules of the globalization era. Unlike recent deals struck by the US, it is WTO-compliant. It signals that countries with limited leverage value the mechanisms and principles that must underpin global trade.

Investor wealth fell by ₹2.73 lakh crore. A hawkish US Fed outlook and a sharp rise in crude prices further pressured sentiment, triggering broad-based declines.

items.title: IndiGo, Air India, SpiceJet face check-in issues due to software problem on Thursday morning
items.summary: A software glitch caused significant disruptions for several airlines at major Indian airports on Thursday morning. IndiGo, Air India Express, SpiceJet, and Akasa Air passengers faced check-in issues. The system outage lasted for over 40 minutes, impacting operations at Delhi, Mumbai, and other locations. The problem has since been resolved, and systems are back to normal.

items.summary: While Bajaj Finance and Shriram Finance often dominate the NBFC space, brokerage firm Citi has turned positive on two other housing finance players. It has maintained a ‘Buy’ rating on both stocks, assigning target prices that indicate potential returns of up to 37–38 per cent, or as much as Rs 200 per share, from current levels.

items.title: Indonesia bond auction weak but not distressing, central bank policy decision awaited
items.summary: Indonesia's recent bond auction saw softer demand, attributed to Lunar New Year holidays, despite market jitters from MSCI's downgrade warning and Moody's outlook cut. While foreign sentiment for rupiah bonds remains stable, concerns over policy predictability and central bank independence persist, impacting the currency.  Authorities raised more than targeted, but bid-to-cover ratios dipped.

items.summary: Oil marketing companies, including BPCL, HPCL, and IOC, saw share price declines of up to 3% due to rising global crude prices, which raised concerns over their marketing margins and earnings amid geopolitical tensions.

items.title: Data tools mustn’t get rusty: India must institutionalize regular statistical revisions
items.summary: India’s consumer price index has finally been updated after more than a decade. The rejection of a key consumption survey had delayed this revision. India now needs an institutional framework to ensure regular statistical updates so policymakers aren’t forced to rely on tools that are outdated.

items.summary: The Prime Minister compared AI's rise to early human discoveries. "When sparks first emerged from stones, no one imagined that those sparks would become the foundation of civilisation. When speech was first transformed into script, no one knew that written knowledge would become the backbone of future systems," he said.

items.title: PhonePe rolls out biometric UPI payments, users can now pay with fingerprint or face ID

While domestic consumption remains a preferred theme, caution persists regarding AI cycle uncertainty and valuation dispersion. Infrastructure and IT sectors await clearer order flows and disruption timelines.

items.title: 30-Day Flying Ban: DGCA proposes stricter rules on 'unruly passengers'
items.summary: The DGCA has proposed stricter rules to deal with unruly passengers on flights. The regulator emphasised that even a single disruptive passenger can jeopardise the safety of an aircraft, its crew, and fellow travellers. It reiterated a “Zero Tolerance Policy” towards unlawful behaviour on board and at airports.

items.title: TCS share price gains on partnership with OpenAI to develop AI infrastructure
items.summary: TCS share price has fallen 14% in one month, and has dropped 10% in the past six months. The Tata Group stock has declined 28% in one year and has slipped 34% in two years.

items.title: Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Jayanti 2026: PM Modi and other leaders highlight Shivaji's legacy of 'Swarajya'
items.summary: Prime Minister Narendra Modi pays tribute to the visionary leader, remarkable administrator, skilled tactician, and champion of Swarajya, Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj. The Prime Minister declared that the bravery of Shivaji Maharaj continues to inspire people, while his governing methods function as a permanent guiding principle, and his dedication to justice and self-respect continues to empower society today.

items.title: Nvidia-Netweb deal: IT stock surges 19% in 2 sessions on launch of its ‘Make in India’ AI supercomputing systems

The launch of the Tyrone Camarero GB200 Supercomputer and Spark system highlights India's growing role in AI innovation and development.

items.title: INOXGFL is successful bidder for Wind World with Rs. 1800-1900 cr offer
items.summary: INOXGFL Group has won the bid to acquire Wind World India’s independent power producer (IPP) and operations & maintenance (O&M) businesses through an NCLT-monitored process, according to Inox Green Energy Services. Financial details were not disclosed, but ET had reported the bid at ₹1,800–1,900 crore.

items.title: Indian brokers' lobby seeks 6-month freeze on new RBI rules: Report
items.summary: India’s brokers’ lobby has urged the Reserve Bank of India to defer its newly issued lending norms for six months, citing operational challenges.

items.title: Waaree Energies set to develop Rs 8,000 crore lithium-ion battery gigafactory in Andhra
items.summary: Waaree Energies will establish India's largest integrated lithium-ion battery gigafactory in Andhra Pradesh. The project, costing Rs 8,175 crore, will be located in Rambilli, Anakapalli district. This facility will manufacture battery cells, packs, and large-scale Battery Energy Storage Systems. It is expected to create 3,000 direct jobs.

items.title: SpiceJet secures MoU for 10 aircraft, bets on more than doubling capacity
items.summary: SpiceJet is set to significantly expand its operations. The airline has received a Memorandum of Understanding for ten new aircraft. This move aims to more than double its capacity within the year. SpiceJet plans to operate over 300 daily flights. This expansion will strengthen connectivity and meet passenger demand. The airline is focused on sustainable growth and fleet restoration.

items.title: Rs 20,000 SIP to Rs 3.8 Crore: How a 5% withdrawal strategy may help beat inflation in retirement
items.summary: An investor contributing Rs 20,000 per month through a Systematic Investment Plan (SIP) for 25 years can build a retirement corpus of around Rs 3.8 crore, assuming a 12 per cent annual return. Financial experts say such a corpus, when shifted to a Systematic Withdrawal Plan (SWP) with a 5 per cent annual withdrawal, can generate nearly Rs 1.58 lakh per month while allowing the remaining amount to stay invested for potential growth.

items.title: Tata Steel share price hits all-time high after Motilal Oswal bullish call; brokerage sees 14% upside
items.summary: Tata Steel share price: At the time of writing, Tata Steel shares were trading at Rs 207.96, down Rs 1.07 or 0.51 per cent for the day. The company’s market capitalisation stood at Rs 2.59 lakh crore. The stock has rallied sharply from its 52-week low of Rs 125.30.

items.title: Tata Investment Corp shares jump 13% on buzz around N Chandrasekaran’s third term at Tata Sons
items.summary: Shares of Tata Investment Corporation rose sharply after Tata Sons was reported to be preparing an EGM to clear N. Chandrasekaran’s third-term reappointment. With Tata Sons holding a majority stake, the move has heightened investor interest amid wider group-level developments and shifting market conditions.

items.title: 5800% return in five years! BSE-listed small-cap tobacco stock jumps over 4%. Do you own?
items.summary: Elitecon International share price rose for the third day, reaching  ₹79.31 on February 19. This is linked to cigarette companies raising prices due to a new excise duty framework, affecting demand and profit margins while keeping the current tax rate unchanged until 2026.

items.title: FIIs turn big bear on IT stocks, pull out another Rs 11,000 crore in 2 weeks
items.summary: Foreign institutional investors are rapidly exiting Indian IT stocks, pulling out nearly Rs 11,000 crore in early February and over Rs 74,000 crore so far in 2025, amid fears that advanced AI tools from firms like Anthropic and Palantir Technologies could disrupt traditional software services models.

items.title: US Stock Market | Foreign buying of US stocks jumps 134% in 2025 despite tariffs
items.summary: Foreign investors more than doubled their purchases of US equities in 2025, defying market volatility triggered by President Donald Trump’s tariffs. Net buying surged 134% to $720.1 billion from $307.5 billion in 2024, according to US Treasury Department data. The strong inflows highlight sustained global appetite for American stocks despite trade tensions and uncertain corporate outlooks.

items.title: DGCA seeks self-sustaining funding model, share of passenger fees as institutional overhaul proposed
items.summary: Regulator proposes share of passenger fees, board-style structure and hiring freedom as staffing shortages and rising fleet expansion strain oversight capacity.

items.title: US single-family housing starts rebound in January, building permits decline

Higher mortgage rates, material costs, and builder sentiment deterioration are constraining the housing market, despite government efforts to improve affordability.

items.title: Japan's 20-year bonds take first super-long auction since election in stride
items.summary: Japan's 20-year bond yield remained stable following a moderately firm auction, showing little reaction to a previous tax-cut pledge that had sent yields soaring. Foreign investors are reportedly leading demand, attracted by higher yields on hedged bonds. Market concerns over political instability have eased after a significant election win, with reduced issuance also supporting investor appetite for super-long JGBs.

Limited apple imports from the US will not affect local growers.

New-age traders are embracing derivatives and algorithmic strategies. Long-term investors continue to rely on earnings growth and SIPs. FII selling persists, but DII inflows provide support. Sector rotation is evident, with some sectors showing signs of overheating.

Gold also deserves a permanent portfolio allocation due to structural global shifts.  The market is set for a rally.

The approach emphasizes flexible, value-biased allocation across geographies and commodities, moving beyond traditional equity, debt, and gold mixes.

items.summary: Quick commerce is forcing logistics companies to move faster, even as higher costs threaten margins.

items.title: M&A funding norms open up a $15-b opportunity for banks
items.summary: New Reserve Bank of India guidelines liberalize merger and acquisition financing, allowing Indian banks to fund up to 75% of acquisition costs with a 3:1 debt-equity ratio. This unlocks a potential $10-15 billion annual opportunity for domestic lenders, previously dominated by offshore entities, fostering a new, high-value asset class.

items.title: Unique transaction ID to be must for OTC derivatives deals: RBI
items.summary: The Reserve Bank of India will mandate unique transaction identifiers (UTIs) for all over-the-counter derivative trades starting January 1, 2027. This move aims to enhance traceability and risk monitoring for instruments like FX and interest rate derivatives.  Market participants must upgrade systems for compliance, with CCIL expected to provide operational guidelines soon.

items.title: Mint Explainer | What India’s uneven EV adoption means for the next phase of green mobility
items.summary: Adoption data shows that EVs are beginning to shape India’s emissions profile in small but visible ways. However, that impact is concentrated in specific segments rather than evenly distributed across the transport system.

items.summary: Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg testified in a landmark Los Angeles trial, saying the company consulted stakeholders on Instagram beauty filters and disputing claims it set goals to increase engagement.

items.title: FedEx plans ₹2,500-cr air cargo hub at Navi Mumbai International Airport
items.summary: FedEx is investing ₹2,500 crore in a new air cargo hub at Navi Mumbai International Airport. This facility will connect India with Southeast Asia, West Asia, Europe, and the US. The hub will create over 6,000 jobs. It will feature automated sorting and dedicated aircraft bays. This project aims to boost trade and reduce logistics costs for businesses.

items.title: Takaichi and Trump Are Natural Fossil Fuel Buddies

items.title: Ethanol capacity surges but 20% blending cap limits demand
items.summary: Distillery capacity is growing faster than ethanol demand. Oil companies expect only a small rise in procurement for petrol blending. New plants will add to existing supply. This situation presents challenges for the ethanol sector. The 20% blending target limits how much more ethanol can be absorbed. Discussions on increasing this target have stalled.

items.title: Nissan to tailor India EV plans after studying speed of adoption, consumer wants
items.summary: Nissan Motor Corp. believes market demand should guide electric vehicle adoption in India. The Japanese automaker will assess customer needs before introducing new technologies. Nissan plans to launch three new vehicles in India within the next year. The company is accelerating its expansion plans in the country, recognizing its significant growth potential.

items.title: FMCG urban sales growth outpaces rural in 2025, overall expansion slows to 4.1%
items.summary: FMCG volume growth in urban markets edged up to 4.6% in 2025, surpassing rural growth which decelerated to 3.6%. This marks the first time urban markets have outpaced rural regions in sales growth for daily essentials. Industry executives anticipate overall FMCG growth to improve this year, projecting acceleration to around 5% by mid-2026.

items.title: Pharma firms asked for side-effects of common medicines
items.summary: India's drug regulator has issued new safety warnings for common medicines. Doxycycline, an antibiotic, will now list side effects like anxiety and dizziness. Carbimazole, used for thyroid issues, will highlight the risk of a life-threatening condition called agranulocytosis. Manufacturers must update package inserts and promotional materials. These changes follow recommendations from pharmacovigilance experts to ensure patient safety.

items.title: From bit role, AI's now the hero of entertainment industry
items.summary: India's film, TV, and OTT sectors are embracing generative AI. This technology is now a core part of content creation, from scripting to post-production. AI tools are reducing costs and timelines while expanding creative possibilities. Companies are investing in AI-driven film projects and unified production systems.

items.title: Gujarat tables Rs 4.08 lakh cr Budget, 10.2% higher compared to last year
items.summary: Gujarat's Finance Minister Kanu Desai unveiled a ₹4,08,053 crore budget for 2026-27. The plan prioritizes developing six regions as growth hubs. Significant funds are allocated for sports infrastructure to prepare Ahmedabad for the 2030 Commonwealth Games and the 2036 Olympics. The budget also aims to boost exports and strengthen the textile industry.

items.title: Telecom operators must be allowed to set up network at Navi Mumbai airport
items.summary: Telecom firms can now deploy networks at Navi Mumbai airport. The Department of Telecommunications has directed the Adani Group-run airport to follow Right of Way rules. This follows complaints from major telcos about exclusive and costly arrangements. The airport had mandated using its own network. Telcos found the charges commercially unviable. The government's intervention ensures fair access for all operators.

items.title: Railway Board orders crackdown on tender cartels
items.summary: In a bid to enhance transparency, Indian Railways is intensifying its oversight on significant contracts. Vigilance teams will meticulously review high-profile tenders and the quality of materials. This strategic initiative aims to combat corruption and foster systemic improvements, particularly focusing on engineering, electrical, signalling, and mechanical sectors.

items.title: AI expansion push: Seven PSBs roll out 32 generative AI use cases under EASE 8.0 programme
items.summary: Seven public sector banks are using generative AI for 32 new applications. These initiatives aim to boost efficiency and credit assessment. Ten banks have formal AI policies. The EASE 8.0 reforms encourage AI for complex tasks and faster decisions. Future reforms, EASErise, will focus on risk management and economic shock absorption. This technology push aligns with national financial goals.

items.title: Red 'table-top' markings for forest highways on cards
items.summary: In a bold move to safeguard wildlife, the government is set to implement standardized red markings along national highways that traverse forested regions. This initiative, following a fruitful trial in Madhya Pradesh, seeks to enhance road safety while minimizing animal fatalities.

items.title: European Stocks Advance After Upbeat BAE Systems, Puig Earnings
items.summary: European stocks rose following a slate of positive results, including from BAE Systems Plc and Puig Brands SA.

items.title: Supreme Court upholds Karnataka's forfeiture of JSW Steel's ₹128 crore performance securities
items.summary: In a significant legal ruling, the Supreme Court has chosen not to intervene with the Karnataka government's decision to confiscate ₹128 crore worth of performance securities from JSW Steel. This measure comes in light of the company's alleged shortfall in meeting iron ore production goals.

items.title: SC rejects RCF plea, orders ₹218cr refund
items.summary: In a significant ruling, the Supreme Court has mandated Rashtriya Chemicals and Fertilizers to refund ₹218 crore, including interest, to Thermax Ltd. This decision reverses an arbitral award as determined by the Bombay High Court, which the apex court has chosen not to contest. Central to this legal battle was the claim for damages resulting from a malfunctioning gas turbine.

items.title: Bangladesh bars SpiceJet from overflying airspace on pending dues
items.summary: Bangladesh has banned SpiceJet from using its airspace due to unpaid air navigation charges, forcing the airline to take longer routes and increasing fuel costs. The budget carrier, facing financial struggles despite recent fundraising, is in communication with Bangladeshi authorities to resolve the issue and resume normal operations.

items.summary: Company unveils one of South Asia’s largest, advanced trailer, truck body manufacturing facility in Sriperumbudur, TN

items.summary: Integrace is currently owned by homegrown PE fund True North and Singapore sovereign investor Temasek Holdings. True North Fund VI LLP holds a 55.83% stake in Integrace, while Temasek arm V-Science Investments Pte owns 43.91%.

items.title: Russia says no reason to believe change in India's stance on Russian oil
items.summary: Russia denies India has stopped buying its oil. Moscow says New Delhi's purchases benefit both nations and stabilize global energy markets. This comes amid US claims that India agreed to halt Russian crude oil imports. India has not confirmed or denied these US assertions. Russia accuses the US of using coercive measures to prevent oil purchases.

items.title: FCI signs MoU with WFP to supply rice to support eradication of global hunger
items.summary: India's Food Corporation of India (FCI) has signed a five-year Memorandum of Understanding with the World Food Programme (WFP) to supply 2 lakh tonnes of rice. items.summary: Channel-wise, commerce-led advertising emerges as the fastest-growing segment at 24.2%, Print to register 4.4% growth, supported by DAVP price increase & sectoral relevance, while television grows at 3.1%. Audio follows at 1.5%.

This pilot used a blockchain-enabled digital platform under the India Energy Stack framework. The initiative aims for a decentralized electricity market. It allows 'prosumers' to trade surplus power directly with other users.

items.title: WPP Media sees India ad market growing 9.7% in 2026 to Rs 2.02 lakh crore
items.summary: India's advertising market is set for significant growth, reaching over Rs 2 lakh crore by 2026. Digital advertising will lead this expansion, capturing a substantial share. Commerce-led formats are emerging as a fast-growing segment. This dynamic market is driven by innovation and evolving consumer behavior. Brands will focus on integrated omnichannel journeys to connect with consumers effectively.

items.summary: India's reliance on Russian oil has decreased significantly. January saw the lowest Russian crude imports since late 2022. Middle Eastern oil now dominates India's imports, reaching its highest share. This shift comes as India navigates Western sanctions and trade agreements. Future imports from Russia are expected to further decline.

items.summary: ICAI is also working with the government on implementing the Corporate Mitra Scheme, aimed at strengthening MSME compliance and advisory support.

The company is focusing on fewer, bigger bets in high-growth areas. Advanced automation and digital technologies will power the expansion. Services include medical emergency assistance and consultations with geriatric specialists. Virtual check-ins by health managers will also be available. This move allows Indian chartered accountant firms to collaborate with international networks. It aims to create larger domestic firms capable of competing globally. The regulations also bring foreign networks operating in India under ICAI's oversight.

Retail inflation also saw its first reading under a new series. Economists noted a gradual increase in inflation since October 2025. The core WPI segment showed a significant jump.

items.title: India-US trade deal: Trade team heading to Washington next week for legal pact

items.summary: On Tuesday, the central bank surprised the market with a 25-basis-point cut to its policy repo rate, or the rate at which it lends to banks, to 6.25 percent.

items.title: Bond bull market may pause but is far from over: Expert
items.summary: The benchmark 10-year government-security yield remained stuck in 8-7.5 percent range through all of 2015 and half of 2016, moving lower to sub-7 percent only when the RBI promised in April to reduce the system's liquidity deficit. The yield may now fall more.

items.title: Scope for meaningful rate cuts going ahead: Neelkanth Mishra
items.summary: Credit Suisse' Neelkanth Mishra expects repo rate to fall to a decade low in the coming quarters. He says that beginning December the market may see a robust and widespread pick-up which may boost indices.

items.title: Tech up to a healthier world
items.summary: Sensors, 3D printed skin, wearables, reconstructed organs, revolutionized clinical trials, personalized medicine and what not – get ready for a new era of healthcare

items.title: Steel stocks rally as govt extends MIP on 66 steel products
items.summary: Stocks like Hindustan Zinc, Hindalco, Jindal Steel, JSW Steel and Tata Steel gained over 1 percent from previous close.

items.title: Endurance Technologies IPO opens: Should you subscribe?
items.summary: The Aurangabad-based company aims to mop up nearly Rs 1,162 crore (at higher end of price band) by diluting 17.5 percent stake through the issue that will close on October 7. It already raised Rs 348.52 crore through anchor investors' portion on Tuesday, the day before issue opening.

items.title: Cautiously optimistic on India; eyeing earnings revival: Sanger
items.summary: Global liquidity tailwinds are unlikely to get any better from now and that makes Arvind Sanger, Managing Partner at Geosphere Capital Management “cautiously optimistic” on the Indian markets.

items.title: Automation threatens 69% jobs in India: World Bank
items.summary: "In large parts of Africa, it is likely that technology could fundamentally disrupt this pattern. Research based on World Bank data has predicted that the proportion of jobs threatened in India by automation is 69 percent, in China it is 77 percent and in Ethiopia, the percentage of jobs threatened by automation is 85 percent," he said.
